de.lmu.ifi.mfa

Class Edge

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lmu.ifi.mfa.Edge
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    class Edge
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Edge class represents a edge in a directed graph from one vertex to another. It supports mainly the functionality to manipulate and push the flow in the edge.

    The class provides methods to set and change the flow directly. Furthermore, it contains auxiliary functions that allow to push preflows forward and backward.

    Additionally, the class provides a method to query data about the current state of the edge as String.

    For additional information, see MFA by Christian Gebhardt on Github.

    Since:
    2016-09-03
    Version:
    1.0.1
    Author:
    Christian Gebhardt

    • Constructor Detail

      • Edge

        protected Edge(Vertex startVertex,
               Vertex endVertex,
               int capacity)
        Create a new directed edge between two vertices in a directed graph with specific capacity. The flow on the edge is initially set to zero.
        Parameters:
        startVertex - the start vertex where the edge starts.
        endVertex - the end vertex where the edge ends.
        capacity - the maximum flow capacity on the edge. It has to be a positive integer.

    • Method Detail

      • getStartVertex

        protected Vertex getStartVertex()
        Get the start vertex of the edge. This vertex normally has the edge in it edge list.
        Returns:
        the start vertex of the edge.

      • getEndVertex

        protected Vertex getEndVertex()
        Get the end vertex of the edge. This vertex normally has the edge in it residual edge list.
        Returns:
        the end vertex of the edge.

      • getCapacity

        protected int getCapacity()
        Get the maximum flow capacity on the edge.
        Returns:
        the maximum flow capacity.

      • getFlow

        protected int getFlow()
        Get the current flow on the edge. The flow is initially zero.
        Returns:
        the current flow.

      • setFlow

        protected boolean setFlow(int flow)
        Set the flow to a specific value. The flow has to be a non-negative integer that is not larger than the maximum flow capacity.
        Parameters:
        flow - the specified flow on the edge.
        Returns:
        true when the operation was successful, otherwise false.

      • isBlocked

        protected boolean isBlocked()
        Return the blocking status of the edge, if it is blocked or not.
        Returns:
        true when the edge is blocked, otherwise false.

      • setBlocked

        protected void setBlocked(boolean blocked)
        Set the blocking status of the edge to be blocked or not blocked.
        Parameters:
        blocked - the blocking status of the edge.

      • pushFlowForward

        protected Vertex pushFlowForward()
        Push flow forward through the edge from the start vertex to the end vertex. This method only pushes the excess forward by increasing the flow when the start vertex has positive excess. It increases the flow by the maximal possible amount.
        Returns:
        the end vertex when it becomes active through the push operation, otherwise null.

      • pushFlowBackward

        protected Vertex pushFlowBackward()
        Push flow backward through the edge from the end vertex to the start vertex. This method only pushes the excess backward by decreasing the flow when the end vertex has positive excess. It decreases the flow by the maximal possible amount.
        Returns:
        the start vertex when it becomes active through the push operation, otherwise null.

      • edgeToString

        public java.lang.String edgeToString()
        Return the basic edge information as a String. This method creates a string that contains the start vertex identifier, the end vertex identifier, the capacity and the current flow of the edge.
        Returns:
        the String representing the basic information of the edge.
